@puplone: Cartoons is the real name. 

Regarding .idx/.sub - only way is to open .idx in SubResync, choose exact FPS, when main window is open choose "Save As...", in lower drop-down list choose Subripper .srt as output format, in line below write output name and press "Save".

Old MicroDVD .sub conversion can be done using Subtitle Workshop - just Open, change input and output fps if needed, then Save As  SubRip....

That's it.

@puplone: Double click on one of the lines at beginning and then near the end. If you see same shift on both, do Edit>Timing>Set delay ... choose + or - for all lines.
Best way to manually readjust subtitles is Edit>Timings>Adjust and enter exact times for first and last line, got from playback window. Sometime lines at the end (often signature of maker) or similar must be deleted before. Good thing is to find one good subtitle and work from there.

Making 720p or 1080p is even more stupid. Burning 4 or 6.6 GB is - act of morons.
Especially because transfer on BR is completely and endlessly done wrong - aspect-ratio from original (1.44) is "widened" to modern 1.77. ALL BluRay rips have such completely wrong aspect ratio.
Therefore I said  "480p only". That is good enough.
